value.title: Disabling auto date-time in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video shows how to disable the date table automatically created by Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/137706

value.title: Formula engine and storage engine in DAX
value.excerpt: Understanding the differences between the formula engine and the storage engine is the first step to understand the performance metrics and optimize a DAX formula. value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: USERELATIONSHIP in calculated columns
value.excerpt: Learn why USERELATIONSHIP is easy to work with in measures, but it can be challenging and give you inaccurate results when used in calculated columns. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Using CONCATENATEX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video showcases the use of CONCATENATEX, a handy DAX function to return a list of values in a measure. Article and download: https://sql.bi/206871
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6gCk4UoOw0g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l5JX3G5Ntzk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Get started with Microsoft Viva Insights (Workplace Analytics)
value.excerpt: Collaboration is a key component of knowledge-worker success. Microsoft Viva Insights (Workplace Analytics) turns Microsoft 365 data into useful insights about how organizations get work done and empowers leaders to drive strategies for positive change. Get started with Microsoft Workplace Analytics introduces how you can use Workplace Analytics to access these insights. You will learn what Workplace Analytics is and how it works, how to onboard to Workplace Analytics from the administrator perspective, how you can evaluate and track collaboration with the Ways of working assessment, and how you can use Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics to drive organizational change.

topItems.title: Analyze collaboration and engagement using the Workplace Analytics Ways of working assessment dashboard
topItems.excerpt: Learn to evaluate collaboration culture and employee experience with a Power BI template using Workplace Analytics data.

topItems.title: Drive organizational change with Microsoft Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics
topItems.excerpt: After using Microsoft Workplace Analytics and Power BI to generate insights about your employees’ work behaviors, you’ll learn about the Microsoft 365 features that can be tools to implement and measure the changes you’ve identified. You’ll learn how to initiate common change practices and what tools and tactics are the most useful.

value.title: Govern data across an enterprise
value.excerpt: Govern data across an enterprise

topItems.title: Discover trusted data using Azure Purview
Manage Power BI artifacts by using Microsoft Purview
topItems.excerpt: Improve data governance and asset discovery using Power BI and Microsoft Purview integration.

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Discover trusted data using Azure Purview
value.excerpt: purview, enterprise data analyst

value.title: Explore data analytics at scale
value.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Power Platform - Introduction, business value, and demos
value.excerpt: Explore the capabilities of Power Platform applications, as seen in demonstrations and customer case studies.

value.title: Get to your data on the go with the Power BI Mobile apps
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll use the Power BI mobile app to review and interact with the content that is available to you in the Power BI service while you're on the go. This module provides the information that you need to work effectively with the Power BI mobile apps.

value.title: Design interactive data experiences with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Power BI enables report authors to produce interactive reports using visuals, slicers, bookmarks, and more.

value.title: Introduction to modern analytics using Excel and Power BI
value.excerpt: This module introduces the Microsoft modern analytics core suite of tools, including Office 365/Excel 2016+, Power Query, Data Model, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI service. By using modern analytics technologies, you and your organization can work faster, more efficiently, and smarter by using Excel together with Power BI.

value.title: Create and manage a Power BI deployment pipeline
value.excerpt: The deployment pipelines tool enables Power BI creators to manage the development lifecycle of organizational content.

value.title: Enhance Power BI report designs for the user interface
value.excerpt: Designing the user interface (UI) is about how reports are consumed, including the appearance and behavior of them, and it is the final report development stage.

value.title: Enhance Power BI report designs for the user experience
value.excerpt: Enhance Power BI report designs for the user experience

value.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

value.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer’s needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

value.title: Drive organizational change with Microsoft Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics
value.excerpt: After using Microsoft Workplace Analytics and Power BI to generate insights about your employees’ work behaviors, you’ll learn about the Microsoft 365 features that can be tools to implement and measure the changes you’ve identified. You’ll learn how to initiate common change practices and what tools and tactics are the most useful.

value.title: Churn Classification Model Comparison with Power BI and Python
value.excerpt: The dashboard was created with Powerbi and Python using three classification algorithms; Random Forest, XGBoost, and Logistic Regression.  The models were used to classify customer churn across a telecommunications company dataset of 7k customers. I wanted to visualize the performance with PowerBI instead
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/J3cyjmuN9vA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Cumulative Distribution Plot in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to create cumulative distribution plot which is a great alternative to a histogram. Histogram can lead to binning bias that will provide different distribution of the same data.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oyo8OwTMM38" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Table Functions: ALL, FILTER, & VALUES
value.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate DAX Table functions in Power BI with real world scenarios. Also learn how to quickly add these functions in to dynamic calculations in DAX.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/n-yO6WXE880" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
